mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'up-and-coming' refer to?

options.a: Something that is declining in popularity
options.b: Someone who is fashionable and up to date
options.c: Someone who is gaining prominence and showing promise
options.d: An event that is about to start very soon

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'up-and-coming' is used to describe someone who is gaining prominence and showing promise in their field or area of expertise.
